info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 8:20PM CDT until July 29 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central and north central Nebraska, including the following counties, in central Nebraska, Custer. In north central Nebraska, Garfield and Loup.
* WHEN...Until 1130 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 820 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Burwell, Calamus Reservoir State Recreation Area, Deverre, Virginia Smith Dam and Homestead Knolls Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Custer, NE; Garfield, NE; Loup, NE
